ong 
range sensors... It looks like, like a pod is landing. We'd better 
ch=
eck it out." Hoist flickers in anticipation as he relays this new 
informat=
ion to Pacifix. "Several of our sensors are still offline, 
and I can't det=
ermine what faction his aligned with; pray it's not 
hostile..." He trails =
off.

"Hmmm," Pacifix gets up, and exits his quarters. "Artemis, get back 
=
as fast as you can. Pacifix out." He reasures himself, "I'll check 
it out.=
 Where did it land?" He continues towards the exit, now at 
walking briskly=
.

"Well, it's, err, within visible range of the base," He 
pauses, "Estima=
ted 800 metres and closing."

"Hostile or not... we shall see." Pacifix mur=
murs to nobody in 
particular as he exits the base. He arms his right freez=
e cannon and 
looks off in the distance where the bot is supposed to be loc=
ated.

Immediately he spots a large cloud of dust, and a large greyish form=
 
advancing at an alarming rate in the center of it. He quickly opens 
a br=
oadband, short range comm to all frequencies, "This is Commander 
Pacifix o=
f the Autobot Earth Mission, state your name and faction." 
Off comm he arm=
s the laser turrets "Laser turrets online." 5 laser 
turrets hidden along t=
he sides of the surrounding mountains fold out 
and begin targeting with th=
e large bot with difficulty.
